All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Block
A single Block class which contains the block number, hash of the block, hash of the previous block transaction list and the merkle root
BlockChain
The BlockChain class is a list of Blocks linked together with has pointers
CoinbaseTransaction
A CoinbaseTransaction is a transaction that is created when a miner finds a new block So they are rewarded with this transaction for their efforts
Crypto
 
GbCoinApplication
 
GbCoinApplicationTests
 
GenesisBlock
The GenesisBlock, which is instantiated only once, is the beginning of the blockchain Here we use it to assume it was found automatically
HashCash
HashCash will be our Proof-of-Work concept which will offer a challenge to the miner to solve once the challenge is solved, the miner will propose the next block and transactions up for consensus This concept was created by Adam Back http://www.hashcash.org/
HashHelper
 
IMiner
 
IMinerObservable
 
IMinerObserver
 
ITransactionObservable
 
ITransactionObserver
 
MainTest
 
MerkleNode
 
MerkleTree
The Merkle Tree data structure which will consist of Merkle Nodes
Miner
Main Miner class
MinerNetwork
This is a basic publisher subscriber pattern Whereas miner object subscribe to a miner network So when a new block is found, it can be distributed to other nodes
SHAUtils
 
Transaction
The Transaction class represents a GB Coin transaction A transaction features a list of Inputs, Outputs, and its own hash
TransactionHandler
The TransactionHandler is responsible for verifying transactions and adding and creating new coins
TransactionNetwork
A TransactionNetwork is a basic subscriber/publisher pattern for new transactions This is not currently being used at the moment
TransactionPool
The TransactionPool is responsible for managing transactions It can add transactions to the pool, get total coin amount and spend new transactions
UTXO
The UTXO represents en unspent Transaction Output meaning it is available to be spent
UTXOPool
the UTXOPool is a data structure to hold all the transaction outputs that are currently available to be spent.
Wallet
The wallet class will hold both private and public keys the private key needs to be kept safe, as it is used to sign transactions the public key can be distributed as it is the form of address
